page.title: 01Summary MELTON ROSS & ELSHAM
page.content: This square of the survey lies in the county of South Humberside,close to it's southern boundary and includes parts of the following parishes ; Melton Ross ,Elsham , Croxton and Wootton.It lies within the North Lincolnshire Wolds. The predominant land use is arable farming .There is one small industrial estate,with a new grain store and an agricultural chemical warehousing and distribution depot. The only other industrial concern,is in former farm buildings ,and sells and maintains agricultual equipment. The main landowner has been the Pelham family of Brocklesby since 1752. The 7th. Earl of Yarborough is its current head.Most of the land is farmed by tenants. This square contains only 7 scattered houses, and no villages.
